thread.title: Collins Barrow Red Deer workshop explains tax-filing obligations to ex-pat U.S. citizens

author: cbs8
title: Collins Barrow Red Deer workshop explains tax-filing obligations to ex-pat U.S. citizens
text:
Collins Barrow National Cooperative Incorporated
RED DEER, AB , Oct. 14, 2015 /CNW/ - On Tuesday, October 20, 2015 , Collins Barrow Red Deer expert Shelley Smith will share valuable insight with expatriate U.S. citizens who need to catch up on their U.S. income taxes. Open to a maximum of 50 participants, the workshop runs from 6 p.m. to 8 p.m. at Black Knight Inn (Salon B).
Shelley oversees Collins Barrow Red Deer's U.S., cross-border and international tax department and advises Canadian companies setting up businesses in the United States and offshore. At the event, she will provide valuable tax planning and compliance guidance to U.S. citizens living in Canada .
"The tax-filing requirements for American citizens living in Canada can be very demanding," she explains. "Our value-added knowledge on U.S. income tax options and obligations will help non-filers accelerate the compliance process and ensure they are making the best choices for their financial future."
